english: to order/book; to subscribe; to agree/fix; to revise/correct

etymology.description: semantic: 言 + phonetic: 丁; simplified from 訂 (訁 → 讠).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the speech element 言 with phonetic 丁 to cue the sound dìng and meanings tied to spoken agreements, ordering, and correction. In simplification, the speech radical was reduced to 讠 while 丁 remained, preserving pronunciation and core sense.
etymology.simplification: 訁 (speech radical) was simplified to 讠 in the left component to reduce strokes; the phonetic 丁 was unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我们订了两张机票(我們訂了兩張機票)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen dìng le liǎng zhāng jīpiào.

examples.chinese: 我订阅了这份杂志(我訂閱了這份雜誌)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ dìngyuè le zhè fèn zázhì.

examples.chinese: 编辑订正了书中的错误(編輯訂正了書中的錯誤)。
examples.pinyin: Biānjí dìngzhèng le shū zhōng de cuòwù.
examples.english: The editor corrected the errors in the book.
